properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 9 at 3:29PM CST by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
properties.description:
Above normal temperatures seen today will be displaced by much
colder air behind a cold front moving through the area this
evening, through the overnight hours. Precipitation will break out
over the Pecos River valley into the mountains of west Texas
before moving quickly to the north and east during the morning.
Temperatures across northern Lea and the northwest Permian Basin
will be near to just below freezing, leading to the first
potential of wintry precipitation in the form of freezing rain
Monday morning.

A break in the precipitation is expected for Monday afternoon and
first half of the overnight into Tuesday, but more precipitation
is expected towards the morning across the region. A second cold
front will press south quickly, leading to temperatures dropping
below freezing over northern Lea county, the Guadalupe Mountains
and the northern Permian Basin during the morning hours.
Precipitation over areas that are near and below freezing will
begin as freezing rain before transitioning to snow and/or sleet
during the afternoon time frame. Snow chances will develop further
south Tuesday night into Wednesday morning as cold air filters
toward the I-20 corridor. All precipitation will end west to east
Wednesday morning. Light snow and ice accumulations are expected
over the Guadalupe Mountains and the northern portions of the
forecast area Tuesday and Wednesday with slick road conditions
likely in areas that see ice and snow.

Be sure to monitor NOAA weather radio and visit our website at
weather.gov/maf for the latest weather updates.

NWSheadline: WINTRY WEATHER RETURNS FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
